course.subject: HUMA
course.name: History of US-China Relations
course.description: An examination of the formation and development of political, economic, and cultural relations between China and the United States from the late 18th century to the mid-20th century.

reviews.author: Shinchan
reviews.comment_content:
The content is about the US-China relation from Qing dynasty to the PRC. The course mainly focus in the 40s-50s. There are lots of reading materials, including the textbook and readings.

The mid-term exam and the final exam are mostly related to the textbook. The textbook is quite interesting but the it’s a bit long. So reading the textbook after every class would be easier to manage with the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Chang’s teaching was pretty good. He would have discussion on the current US-China issues with the students every class to show the patterns of the US-China relations.

He did prepare ppt for the class, but I think the ppt is not enough to deal with the exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was pretty heavy. In one semester, Prof required two exams, pop up quizes, final essay and timeline.

In the two exams, students need to have a take home exam. Citing the textbook would get higher marks in the essay so it would be IMPORTANT to read the textbook and readings after every class!
